notes.text:
Multiple vulnerabilities affecting various third-party components of SCALANCE W-700 IEEE 802.11ax devices before V2.0 could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service condition, disclose sensitive data or violate the system integrity.

Siemens has released an update for SCALANCE W-700 IEEE 802.11ax and recommends to update to the latest version.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: Siemens Security Advisories are subject to the terms and conditions contained in Siemens' underlying license terms or other applicable agreements previously agreed to with Siemens (hereinafter "License Terms"). To the extent applicable to information, software or documentation made available in or through a Siemens Security Advisory, the Terms of Use of Siemens' Global Website (https://www.siemens.com/terms_of_use, hereinafter "Terms of Use"), in particular Sections 8-10 of the Terms of Use, shall apply additionally. In case of conflicts, the License Terms shall prevail over the Terms of Use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

Further dissemination of this product is governed by the Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) marking in the header. For more information about TLP, see https://us-cert.cisa.gov/tlp/.
notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: This CISA CSAF advisory was converted from Siemens ProductCERT's CSAF advisory.
notes.title: Advisory Conversion Disclaimer

notes.text: Multiple
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: Germany
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the exploitation risk of this vulnerability.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, and ensure they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most recent version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as its connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets. Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

cwe.name: Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information

notes.text: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., when compressing) if the input has many distant matches.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference in Busybox's man applet leads to denial of service when a section name is supplied but no page argument is given.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: An out-of-bounds heap read in Busybox's unlzma applet leads to information leak and denial of service when crafted LZMA-compressed input is decompressed. This can be triggered by any applet/format that internally supports LZMA compression.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: An incorrect handling of a special element in Busybox's ash applet leads to denial of service when processing a crafted shell command, due to the shell mistaking specific characters for reserved characters. This may be used for DoS under rare conditions of filtered command input.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference in Busybox's hush applet leads to denial of service when processing a crafted shell command, due to missing validation after a \x03 delimiter character. This may be used for DoS under very rare conditions of filtered command input.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

cwe.name: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference

notes.text: An attacker-controlled pointer free in Busybox's hush applet leads to denial of service and possible code execution when processing a crafted shell command, due to the shell mishandling the &&& string. This may be used for remote code execution under rare conditions of filtered command input.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in Busybox's awk applet leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the getvar_i function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in Busybox's awk applet leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the next_input_file function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the clrvar function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the hash_init function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the getvar_s function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the evaluate function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in Busybox's awk applet leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the handle_special function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the evaluate function.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: A use-after-free in awk leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the nvalloc function.
notes.title: Summary

cwe.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

notes.text: jQuery Cookie 1.4.1 is affected by prototype pollution, which can lead to DOM cross-site scripting (XSS).
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version
